There is No Peacetime: Volumetric Attacks Continue Unabated

DDoS attacks don’t observe holidays. They don’t take breathers. They don’t honor white flags. There are no truces, no prisoner swaps, no treaties or negotiations. Thousands of attacks are taking place at this very moment around the world with no sign of let-up. Peace is clearly not at hand.

Evolution of HTTP and DNS for 5G

HTTP (Hypertext Transmission Protocol) is the internet communication protocol our browser uses to send information between our internet-enabled device (laptop, smartphone, Apple® watch, etc.,) and the web page it is communicating to. DNS (Domain Name System) is the protocol that translates internet addresses to find the various sites and information we seek.
